channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance Network

item.title: 1hundred
item.description: 1hundred is a project that's been in development over the last 2.5 years. I've aimed to create a context for collaboration with other artists, craftsman, and creators of 'things' to produce and sell our own quality products. The idea is based on the premise that less is more. Small production numbers means you guys get the benefit of limited edition products not every Dom, Dick, and Harry will have and we get to focus our attention on making products with soul, that arent just mass-produced. Time and effort is being spent on the details, taking special care to make the products the best they can be. Its not about making a quick buck, but to produce something really worth having.
item.content:encoded: 1hundred is a project that's been in development over the last 2.5 years. I've aimed to create a context for collaboration with other artists, craftsman, and creators of 'things' to produce and sell our own quality products. The idea is based on the premise that less is more. Small production numbers means you guys get the benefit of limited edition products not every Dom, Dick, and Harry will have and we get to focus our attention on making products with soul, that arent just mass-produced. Time and effort is being spent on the details, taking special care to make the products the best they can be. Its not about making a quick buck, but to produce something really worth having.

item.title: Noteworthy app concept
item.description: Noteworthy is a notetaking app. Nothing more, nothing less. This is just a design concept made in free time, so don't expect fully functional app soon. Feel free to share this work across the internet!

item.title: THEORY OF MOMENTS [ part I ]
item.description: Theory of Moment [ part I ] (On-going project). Temporary site specific installations in empty spaces and abandoned courtyards in XianYuKou district in Beijing. The neighbourhood is under threat of demolition and people are expected to leave it. In this situation of uncertainty for many of the local inhabitants, the project works through different approaches and media. Graphics patterns to decorate the public walls, redefinition of public spaces using existing materials founded on site, insertions of little elements to be used as playground, interactive installations with colours and sounds will define a series of moments rich of meaning in which to intensify the vital productivity of everydayness, according to the definition by Henri Lefebvre (Theory of Moments in La Somme et le Reste, 1959).
item.content:encoded: Theory of Moment [ part I ] (On-going project). Temporary site specific installations in empty spaces and abandoned courtyards in XianYuKou district in Beijing. The neighbourhood is under threat of demolition and people are expected to leave it. In this situation of uncertainty for many of the local inhabitants, the project works through different approaches and media. Graphics patterns to decorate the public walls, redefinition of public spaces using existing materials founded on site, insertions of little elements to be used as playground, interactive installations with colours and sounds will define a series of moments rich of meaning in which to intensify the vital productivity of everydayness, according to the definition by Henri Lefebvre (Theory of Moments in La Somme et le Reste, 1959).

item.title: TicketLeap
item.description: TicketLeap is ticketing the way it should be done, providing events of all sizes with a simple yet powerful ticketing experience. As TicketLeap emerged as an industry leader, it needed a new brand that reflected both its level of professionalism and the seamless experience it offers. We worked with TicketLeap to create the new face of the business that can take the company to its next level of growth, including branding, positioning, site design, advertising, and various collateral.
item.content:encoded: TicketLeap is ticketing the way it should be done, providing events of all sizes with a simple yet powerful ticketing experience. As TicketLeap emerged as an industry leader, it needed a new brand that reflected both its level of professionalism and the seamless experience it offers. We worked with TicketLeap to create the new face of the business that can take the company to its next level of growth, including branding, positioning, site design, advertising, and various collateral.

item.title: Belle & Clive
item.description: Sub Rosa partnered with the Bluefly.com team to design and conceive of a new brand and business focused on the rising flash sale trend. The result was Belle & Clive - a flash sale fashion platform that the brand rolled out to rave reviews. The site features included a deep content and inventory management system designed to meet the needs of the rapid rotation of products common on flash sale sites. In addition the overall naming, brand identity, and aesthetic look and feel, created a unified experience that was at once timeless and contemporary. Sub Rosa is working on future efforts with Belle & Clive to include other shopping verticals such as food and travel.
item.content:encoded: Sub Rosa partnered with the Bluefly.com team to design and conceive of a new brand and business focused on the rising flash sale trend. The result was Belle & Clive - a flash sale fashion platform that the brand rolled out to rave reviews. The site features included a deep content and inventory management system designed to meet the needs of the rapid rotation of products common on flash sale sites. In addition the overall naming, brand identity, and aesthetic look and feel, created a unified experience that was at once timeless and contemporary. Sub Rosa is working on future efforts with Belle & Clive to include other shopping verticals such as food and travel.

item.title: ABSA Cityscape
item.description: I was asked to illustrate a South African cityscape comprised of Cape Town, Johannesburg and Durban. The illustration serves the purpose of an interactive display at ABSA branches, where clients interact with the illustration through a touch display that provides information about the services offered by ABSA. Here are some selected segments from the Cityscape. There is also a video segment panning through the Cityscape.
item.content:encoded: I was asked to illustrate a South African cityscape comprised of Cape Town, Johannesburg and Durban. The illustration serves the purpose of an interactive display at ABSA branches, where clients interact with the illustration through a touch display that provides information about the services offered by ABSA. Here are some selected segments from the Cityscape. There is also a video segment panning through the Cityscape.

item.title: London
item.description: WORK AND PLAY project started at the end of the Beijing Olympic Games. It is made up of a series of images which illustrate the peak-time of economic crisis in the city of brokers (2009). With WORK AND PLAY, I tried to capture the loneliness so characteristic in London in those days. An atmosphere of widespread despair became evident in Great Britain more clearly than elsewhere in Europe. This work focused on two distinct aspects. I photographed both gloomy atmosphere in the financial quarters and traditional English sport events. The project does not want to be a classic photo reportage where each photo is combined with an explanatory caption.This collection of photographs highlights the feeling of loneliness and worry due to the economic crisis to inspire reflection on the current situation in London. It focuses on the atmosphere in dark places of the city and in the meantime it shows the importance of "faith" in sport which is particularly strong through all the country. WORK AND PLAY is a pun. PLAY is illustrated as playing sports but it contains all possible meanings of the word : play an instrument, play a game or play a drama. The PLAY lifestyle is a way of entertainment to escape everyday sorrow and being proud of something. Waiting for 2012 Olympic Games these two characters of British people become more and more evident : on one side they have to face economic crises but on the other side they still supporters of their favourite athletes .
item.content:encoded: WORK AND PLAY project started at the end of the Beijing Olympic Games. It is made up of a series of images which illustrate the peak-time of economic crisis in the city of brokers (2009). With WORK AND PLAY, I tried to capture the loneliness so characteristic in London in those days. An atmosphere of widespread despair became evident in Great Britain more clearly than elsewhere in Europe. This work focused on two distinct aspects. I photographed both gloomy atmosphere in the financial quarters and traditional English sport events. The project does not want to be a classic photo reportage where each photo is combined with an explanatory caption.This collection of photographs highlights the feeling of loneliness and worry due to the economic crisis to inspire reflection on the current situation in London. It focuses on the atmosphere in dark places of the city and in the meantime it shows the importance of "faith" in sport which is particularly strong through all the country. WORK AND PLAY is a pun. PLAY is illustrated as playing sports but it contains all possible meanings of the word : play an instrument, play a game or play a drama. The PLAY lifestyle is a way of entertainment to escape everyday sorrow and being proud of something. Waiting for 2012 Olympic Games these two characters of British people become more and more evident : on one side they have to face economic crises but on the other side they still supporters of their favourite athletes .
